full_summary:
Government Tender Announcement
=============================

**Coastal Erosion Armour Stone Installation**

**Request for Proposal**

Parks Canada invites bidders to submit proposals for the installation of a coastal erosion armour stone barrier at the Fortress of Louisbourg National Historic Site in Louisbourg, Nova Scotia.

**Contract Details**

* **Contract Number**: PW-22-01005362
* **Amendment Number**: 1
* **Solicitation Number**: 5P468-22-0048/B
* **Closing Date**: 2022-09-08 at 14:00 (Atlantic Daylight Time)
* **Estimated Contract Value**: $1,000,001 to $2,500,000 (inclusive of taxes)

**Scope of Work**

The proposal requires the installation of a coastal erosion armour stone barrier along Route 22 at the Fortress of Louisbourg Historic National Site. The work includes site improvements and installation of the armour stone barrier.

**Security Requirements**

None

**Site Visit**

An optional site visit was scheduled for September 1st, 2022, at 10:00 AM (local time). Bidders are encouraged to attend to familiarize themselves with the site conditions. Safety attire is mandatory.

**Bid Submission Requirements**

* Bids submitted via fax and email will be accepted as official.
* Bids submitted in-person or by courier may not be accepted.
* The only acceptable email address for responses to the bid solicitation is [soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca](mailto:soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca).
* Bids submitted via email directly to the Contracting Authority or to any email address other than [soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca](mailto:soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca) will not be accepted.
* The maximum email file size is 15 megabytes.

**Timeline**

* Contract commencement: Upon award of contract
* Contract completion: December 31, 2022

**Important Documents**

The following documents are available:

* Bid solicitation documents: [available on Buy and Sell GC](https://buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders)
* Addenda: When issued, will be available on Buy and Sell GC

**Queries and Clarifications**

All queries and clarifications must be submitted in writing, and must be received no later than five (5) business days prior to the closing date.
